entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
12/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Scout Realtime – Realtime server metrics in your browser
  • Curator’s Code – Keep the rabbit hole of the internet open by honoring discovery
  • Jurassic Systems – Just. Epic.
Alex:
  • Command Line Cheat Sheet – Cheat sheet explains the essential tasks on the command line.
  • gitsh – gitsh provides you with a dedicated shell just for your Git commands.
  • rails-mrap-seed – For those who need to go fast on Rails.
Ben:
  • simple animated screen captures – create little gifs from your screen
  • Visualizing Rails Issues – Awesome use of D3.js by @joannecheng at Kod.io Linz 2014
  • Aviation is stuck in the 60s, a reflection on MH 370
Tony:
  • How to review a merge commit – Invaluable skill in teams
  • Rails and OmniAuth – an example application
  • RailsApps Build and Learn – main page of the above example

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/03 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • ArnoldC – Hasta la vista, baby
  • Kod.io by karlhorky – In case you missed kod.io last week.. Here are some notes
  • JavaScript For Cats – because kittens.
Alex:
  • CodeKit – CodeKit helps you build websites faster and better.
  • elasticsearch-rails – elasticsearch-rails version 0.1.0 is out.
  • git grep – Search a git repo like a ninja.
Ben:
  • Moon – If The Moon Was Only 1 Pixel.
  • goto fail in GNUtls – Critical crypto bug leaves Linux, hundreds of apps open to eavesdropping
  • Spritz – Maybe the worst name ever, but they have some nice things about speed reading.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
26/02 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-fourth edition:

Laura:
  • WhatTheCommit – Inspiration for your commit messages
  • Kod.io Linz – Guess what’s on this weekend? Come join us in Linz!
  • Power Rake – Jim Weirich’s GoRuCo 2012 talk about the “hidden” features of rake
Alex:
  • hipster dev deck – A curated directory of artisanal development tools that we used to like before they went mainstream
  • First Time User Experiences – A showcase of new user experiences, good and bad, from a variety of products.
  • Authorization – Handling Authorization in a Service-Oriented Architecture
Ben:
  • Eye – Process monitoring tool. Inspired from Bluepill and God.
  • Atom – A new Editor by the GitHub guys.
  • Base – One Base Class to Rule Them All

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
19/02 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-third edition:

Laura:
  • Boxen – Automate the pain out of your development environment
  • Acts As Enid – Following my own link from last week, I put together a useless gem that spits out quotes from Ghost World. Enidify!
Alex:
  • RubyMotion – Building OS X apps with RubyMotion
  • North – Design and development standards to align and guide your project.
  • UX Fundamentals – UX crash course – 31 fundamentals
Ben:
  • iPhone – How Apple Protects Your iPhone from Your Employer
  • The Passion Gospel – it’s a long piece, make sure to read the whole piece
  • fleet – Cluster-Level Container Deployment with fleet

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
12/02 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-second edition:

Laura:
  • GitSh – An interactive shell for Git
  • Acts as Charlie Sheen – Make your own Charlie Sheen gem
  • 100 days later – “To form a habit, commit to do it often”
Alex:
  • Clever Algorithms – Nature-Inspired Programming Recipes
  • Brackets – Brackets is an open source code editor for web designers and front-end developers.
  • Docker on Mac – How To Install Docker On Mac OS X

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
05/02 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the forty-first edition:

Laura:
  • Open Data – Thirty places to find open data on the web
  • Figaro – A clean and simple way to configure your (open source) app and keep the private stuff private
  • Raptor Editor – Haven’t tried it yet, but the name is just too cool
Alex:
  • The Magic Tricks of Testing – Sandi Metz about testing
  • Regularity – A friendly regular expression builder for Ruby
  • AngularJS and Rails 4 – How to integrate AngularJS with Rails 4
Ben:
  • The Magic of Strace – know your tools! how to get some insights into your UNIX processes
  • Making Time for Side Projects – Planning is key!
  • Don’t let your shell manage your ENV vars – Use tools like Dotenv or Figaro instead!
Tony:
  • Switcher – The website switching extension you always wanted. A Chrome Extension for devs.
  • Who Dictates Software Quality: Client or Coder? – And how about you?
  • ominref – comprehensive ruby documentation search

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
29/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fortieth edition:

Laura:
  • Austria Game Jam 2014 – The links to this year’s games are online. Play away!
  • Web applications with Ruby (not Rails) – David Padilla’s talk from ArrrrCamp.
  • Have I been pwned? – …because data breaches.
Alex:
  • 467 tests, 0 failures, 0 confidence – Katrina Owen about the purpose of tests.
  • Trailer – A faster and easier way to deal with pull requests
  • Dot Navigation Styles – Subtle effects for simple dot navigation
Ben:
  • Tales of an Ops Team: Confessions of a Chatbot
  • Prototype based programming – Featuring: Self, NewtonScript, Io, and, yes, JavaScript. Plus: the dunder is back
Tony:
  • $://showterm – Record Terminal Sessions! And it’s in Ruby, too!
  • Of Orcs and Software Craftsmanship – XML parsing, a developer’s view. Don’t let the foreign language (=Java) discourage you!
  • International Table Top Day – Play More Games! (I admit, I am a fan)

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
22/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-ninth edition:

Laura:
  • Nerdy Data – A search engine for source code.
  • Architecture the Lost Years – Uncle Bob’s keynote from Ruby Midwest 2011.
Alex:
  • Mocking HTML5 API – Mocking HTML5 geolocation API using PhantomJS extensions
  • Elasticsearch – ActiveModel, ActiveRecord and Ruby on Rails integrations for Elasticsearch
  • Bower and Rails – Bower and Rails on Heroku and S3
Tony:
  • How to – Convince Your Manager to Use Open Source Software
  • Valve games for Debian Developers – Open Source Pays Back
  • The world is watching via unusual channels, too – Good Luck, Ukraine!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
15/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-eighth edition:

Laura:
  • The Command Line Murders – A command-line murder mystery. How cool is that?
  • Speaking.io – Thoughts on public speaking by GitHub’s Zach Holman
  • GitHub Stargazers – making your stargazers twinkle!
Alex:
  • Rails Concern – Understanding how ‘Concern’ works will help you better understand how Ruby’s ‘Module’ works.
  • Gemsurance – Gemsurance is a tool for monitoring if any of your Ruby Gems are out-of-date or vulnerable.
  • Job Stories – Designing features using job stories.
Ben:
  • RSpec Matchers – Composable Matchers in RSpec 3
  • Ruby Syntax Trivia – Neat little Ruby tricks
  • How does SSL work? – What every developer should know about SSL.
Tony:
  • try_to – Sophisticated, configurable error handling that can be used instead of Object#try.
  • “Make the world a better place” – … put a license in your gemspec.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
08/01 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-seventh edition:

Laura:
  • Projects – A list of practical projects to be solved in any language.
  • The Mathematical Reality of Reality – An interview with cosmologist Max Tegmark.
  • Cruncher – An implementation of Bret Victor’s Scrubbing Calculator.
Alex:
  • Spacegray – A set of minimal Sublime Text 2/3 themes.
  • Sublime Ruby Debugger – Debugger plugin for interactive ruby and RoR debugging on Sublime Text.
  • CDN for Rails – Setting up a cloudfront CDN for Rails.
Ben:
  • Connection Pooling – Setting ActiveRecord’s connection pool size on Heroku with Puma or Sidekiq
  • FFmpeg Security – FFmpeg and a thousand fixes
Tony
  • Martin Fowler: Branch by Abstraction – Make a large-scale change while releasing regularily.
  • Mocks are “breaking encapsulation” – Grzegorz Gałęzowski disagrees with his notions (and I agree with him).
  • Extreme Programming, a Reflection – Uncle Bob Martin gives a lot of nostalgia a reality check. We’ve come far!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
01/01 yesterdays picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Let’s Talk About Clients – Oldie but Goldie: Michael Bierut’s talk at the NYC Creative Mornings
  • Vmail – A Vim Interface to Gmail
  • Girls haven’t been hacking for the last 10 years – A good article focusing on the heart of the problem
Alex:
  • SVG Drawing Animation – Line drawing animation with illustration fade-in
  • Haml’s little-known list_of helper – The list_of method will iterate and yield the results of the block into sequential list elements.
  • Polybox – A combo of Docker and Vagrant to make full dev environments easily available. Prestocked with boxes for Rails 4, Django, Go, Haskell, and Nodejs.
Ben:
  • Removing the GIL in Ruby – Eliminating Global Interpreter Locks in Ruby through Hardware Transactional Memory
  • Ruby 2.1 Garbe Collectors – nice write up of the changes in Ruby 2.1
  • The Lost Art of C Structure Packing

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
25/12 Picks Happy Christmas Everyone!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-fifth edition:

Floor:
  • from .meh to .fabulous – OMG RAINBOW DIVIDERS IN CSS! (by the awesome, Chris Heilmann and Lea Verou)
  • adaptive backgrounds – Extract dominant colors from images and applying it to its parent.
  • Codecademy – jQuery – I intend to become a jQuery MASTER over Christmas.
Alex:
  • Thoughtbot Podcast – GIANT ROBOTS SMASHING INTO OTHER GIANT ROBOTS PODCAST
Ben:
  • GitHub Explore – subscribe to the newsletter to stay up to date on GitHub
  • Ruby 2.1 – Ruby 2.1: Profiling Ruby
  • Papers, Please – have some spare time during the holidays? play Papers, please!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
18/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-fourth edition:

Floor:
  • Open Source Programming Book for Kids – because awesome.
  • Learn CSS Frameworks on Treehouse – ain’t nobody got time for plain CSS these days.
  • Decoding “Almost Sinatra” – Remember Herr Haase bringing Sinatra down to a mere 7 lines of code? Let’s take a closer look!
Laura:
  • Hello Ruby – A very special Advent calendar by Linda Liukas.
  • SpaceCalNYC – Space! A nice app that plots every object observed by NASA’s space-based telescopes.
  • How To Not Be An Expert – Jen Myers’ talk at the GitHub Passion Projects
Alex:
  • Thoughtbot Podcast – GIANT ROBOTS SMASHING INTO OTHER GIANT ROBOTS PODCAST
  • Progress Button Styles – Creative effects for loading buttons
  • How I Built Emojitracker – Adventures in Unicode, Real-time Streaming, and Media Culture
Ben:
  • Grace Hopper on Lettermann
  • 33 questions – find questions which identify everyone on this planet
  • Guy Kawasaki “The Art of the Start”

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
11/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-third edition:

Andy:
  • On Array indices – Should they start at 0 or 1?
  • roar – Resource-Oriented Architectures in Ruby.
  • Architecture the Lost Years – Keynote by Robert Martin at the Ruby Midwest 2011. Still a must watch!
Floor:
  • kod.io – March 1st, Linz will host kod.io – a developer conference around Python, Ruby and JavaScript (and all its frameworks). Go check it out.
  • tmate – Instant terminal sharing ftw.
  • MiniCodeEditor – A HTML/CSS/JavaScript code editor in 230+ bytes!
Laura:
  • PythonTrek – Because who doesn’t love a Star Trek/Monty Python generator? Bonus: you can view all generated phrases on the official twitter account!
  • Are you a FontAwesome Pro? – So, are you?
  • –
Alex:
  • Drawing on canvas – Exploring canvas drawing techniques
  • Text-only UI sketches – Before sketching in that notebook, try writing out your UI first.
  • Sinatra Cookbook – Recipes for the Ruby framework
Ben:
  • TracePoint – An Introduction to TracePoint in Ruby 2.0
  • OpenEmu – play all your childhood games! howto build
  • –

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-second edition:

Andy:
  • Writing Better Specs – 10 Basic steps that help you write cleaner and more focused tests.
  • Demystifying the Ruby GC – The Ruby Garbage Collector under the hood.
  • Nerdbot 2.0 Based on Lita – Because robots are awesome.
Floor:
  • Arduino-Bootcamp – You REALLY want to attend the last Arduino-Bootcamp of the year, at Hotel Karolinenhof in Vienna, on December 7th.
  • List.js – Search, sort, and filter your HTML tables, lists, and more!
  • 24 Pull Requests – Giving back little gifts of code for Christmas.
Laura:
  • ExplainShell – Match command-line arguments to their help text.
  • FishShell – Because the 90s are back.
  • Mathematica – Mathematica now free for the Raspberry Pi.
Alex:
  • Free Programming Books – About like everything.
  • Which HTML color are you? – Why does HTML think “chucknorris” is a color?
  • Mature Optimization Handbook – Performance measurement and optimization.
Ben:
  • list of computer technology code names – Ever ran out of names for you projects or physical devices? pick a code name!
  • Blue Shell – friendly command-line matchers for shell scripting in ruby using RSpec.
  • How Github (no longer) Works.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
27/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-first edition:

Andy:
  • watson – Creat GitHub and Bitbucket issues straight from your source code.
  • Greetings from Flynn – A Flynn Demo and Roadmap of the open source SaaS.
  • Know your Ruby switches – Ruby’s -e, -n and -p switches for the command line.
Floor:
  • R2D – A gem for 2D graphics in Ruby. Under ‘heavy development’, but interesting nevertheless.
  • webfont icons – How to use webfont icons as bullet points in HTML5 lists.
  • Chrome DevTools – Get your Chrome DevTools basics right with this Treehouse course.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
20/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirtieth edition:

Andy:
  • Struct – Great RubyTapas episode on Struct.
  • Que – A queue for Ruby applications that manages jobs using PostgreSQL’s advisory locks. Yeah.
  • bundler_ext – Using gem and system installed Ruby dependencies side by side.
Floor:
  • Gitter – Chat. For GitHub.
  • Hacker School – Apply to the Winter 2014 Batch.
  • RoR workshop in Vienna – … we’re hosting one. Tell your friends/family!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
13/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-nineth edition:

Andy:
  • Gobot – Go, Robot, Go! Golang for Robotics.
  • artoo – Ruby + Robots = <3
  • Try ALF – Relational Algebra at your Ruby fingertips.
Floor:
  • Codepen – I love browsing codepens, like these cool Chrome logo’s.
  • Statistics Done Wrong – The woefully complete guide
  • GitHub profile decorator – Show off your ASCII skills with GitHub profile decorator!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
6/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-eighth edition:

Andy:
  • Writing a (Ruby) compiler in Ruby bottom up – step 29 – The Operators – Part 3: Operating on our newly minted Fixnums.
  • Open Data Index – The Open Data Index assesses the state of open government data around the world.
  • Setting up Emacs as Ruby development environment on OSX – Has a few nice tips and tricks for Emacs operators who write Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
Floor:
  • backbone – Check out this free Frontend Masters lesson, where Sam steps through an example using a model, collection and view together in Backbone.js.
  • gosu – Programming games – A 10 minute crash course with Patrick Huesler (Wooga).
  • jumpstartlab – Ruby tutorials ftw! <3

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
23/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-seventh edition:

Andy:
  • Wiener BEAMers – A new meetup in Vienna about Erlang/OTP Elixir & friends.
  • How to become a better developer – The write-up to his talk at the October vienna.rb meetup.
  • Raspberry Pi + Go = Robot – Follow Will on his path building a robot with a Raspberry Pi and Golang.
Floor:
  • GitHub Arduino – Fun! Displaying realtime Github activity on a full color LED Matrix.
  • Changelog #108 – The Changelog talking Exercism.io with Katrina Owen.
  • Europe Code Week – 25-30 November is Europe Code Week! Join the fun!
